intro: [WRONG START] Pleurotholis bifalcis, commonly known as the two-lobed orchid, is a species native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, epiphytic growth habit. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in a raceme. Its leaves are usually dark green and strap-shaped, providing a striking contrast to its delicate blooms. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is a sought-after species among orchid enthusiasts.
